@abucci@anthony.buc.ci It is.

↳ In-reply-to » -12 °C this morning 🥶 We have power though!

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci Ooof gawd that’s cold 🥶

↳ In-reply-to » google/git-appraise: Distributed code review system for Git repos -- Interesting way to do code reviews, kind of very similar to git-bug 🤔

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci Fair 😅 The only exception I personally find the Go language itself, not really a Google™ product/project, but one created by Rob Pike Ken Thompson and Robert Griesemer.

↳ In-reply-to » google/git-appraise: Distributed code review system for Git repos -- Interesting way to do code reviews, kind of very similar to git-bug 🤔

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci Like most things, this is unlikely to be an actual “Google” product or project, just someone yet another Google™ engineer wrote in his/her spare time… Which is a good thing, we should use/contribute/collaborate and share such things as they really are great engineers many of them 👌

↳ In-reply-to » @justamoment Combining messages from other sources into a new feed would also lead to new hashes, hence screwing up conversations badly. So this won't work with regular feeds. But I just remembered that there is a Twtxt Registry Format, that could be used. Not sure how many clients support this, though, e.g. mine doesn't. But I view lists also as a client feature.

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org I wonder whether we can represent this data format as the result of a query? 🤔

↳ In-reply-to » google/git-appraise: Distributed code review system for Git repos -- Interesting way to do code reviews, kind of very similar to git-bug 🤔

@marado Yeah it does seem cool, and yeah @lyse@lyse.isobeef.org its dependencies does seem pretty nice and short, but what I don’t like about it is how it stores the data as JSON files in a “special branch”. I much prefer the way git-bug stores the data, however I’ve run into a problem with even getting gith bug push to work in the first place 🤦‍♂️

↳ In-reply-to » google/git-appraise: Distributed code review system for Git repos -- Interesting way to do code reviews, kind of very similar to git-bug 🤔

Hmmm not sure if I like the way this is done… 🤔
